byline.contributor: Jason Horowitz reported from Underwood, and Yamiche Alcindor from Des Moines. Nick Corasaniti contributed reporting from Chicago.
byline.original: By JASON HOROWITZ and YAMICHE ALCINDOR

abstract: Bernie Sanders's presidential campaign has launched major effort to court young voters in Iowa, group with which senator has strong pull but which is notoriously unreliable; Sanders acknowledges defeating Hillary Clinton in Iowa depends on his ability to motivate youth.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Sanders has struck a chord with young people, but his campaign acknowledges that beating Hillary Clinton in Iowa will require overcoming their history of dismal attendance.

headline.main: Bernie Sanders Courts Elusive Voters: Young Iowans
headline.print_headline: Sanders Courts Elusive Voters: Young Iowans

snippet: Mr. Sanders has struck a chord with young people, but his campaign acknowledges that beating Hillary Clinton in Iowa will require overcoming their history of dismal attendance.
